item.title: About
item.description:
Hi, I’m Ekky, currently a Senior Site Reliability Engineer.

I’m a lifelong learner, a systems thinker, and a builder at heart.

My journey in tech has always been driven by curiosity. I don’t just work with systems, I obsess over how they behave, how they break, and how to make them better, faster, and more resilient. Whether it’s infrastructure, automation, security, observability, or developer tooling, I find joy in diving deep into complexity and emerging with clarity, structure, and solutions that make a real impact.

item.title: Professional Experience
item.description:
Quipper | Senior Site Reliability Engineer

Remote, 2022 â€” Present

As the Senior SRE, I own the reliability and developer-experience charter across multi-cloud infrastructure, pushing automation, observability, and CI/CD maturity so teams can ship faster with confidence.

  • Migrated CI/CD from CircleCI to GitHub Actions with self-hosted runners, saving ~$6K/month and enabling reusable workflows.
  • Cut end-to-end tests from 2 hours to 15 minutes (â‰ˆ$60K/year savings) and lifted developer productivity by 83% through pipeline instrumentation and deployment insights.
  • Hardened public endpoints via AWS CloudFront + WAF and delivered an AI-powered documentation copilot that reduces SRE support load.

Tech Stacks: AWS, GCP, Azure, Terraform, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, GitHub, GitHub Action, CircleCI, Jenkins, ArgoCD, Datadog, Sentry, OpenSearch, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
